definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
(coll.) foot of an animal or bird/(coll.) foot supporting a cooking pot etc
foot of a bird or animal/paw/claws/talons

sentences.english: He put one big hairy paw ahead of him.
sentences.chinese: 它把一隻毛茸茸的腳爪伸到前面。

sentences.english: A hen's claw has three toes .
sentences.chinese: 母雞的腳爪有三個腳趾。

sentences.english: The dog pressed his paw on the latch to let himself in.
sentences.chinese: 那狗用腳爪按住門閂把自己放進來。

sentences.english: With white claws of foam the sea grabbled at the shore.
sentences.chinese: 大海帶着白色的浪沫腳爪，在海灘上摸索着。
我的腳爪像天鵝絨一般。

sentences.english: Front feet turning in or out.
The animals learned to press switch levers with their paws.
sentences.chinese: 動物學習用它們的腳爪撳按開關。

definition: lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
extraordinary strength/super strong/strong as an ox
just a word or two (idiom); a few isolated phrases
to bore/to burrow/to crawl through a tunnel
see 眾星捧月|众星捧月[zhong4 xing1 peng3 yue4]
